comments.body: Why not Java?  We should have this feature in both.

I don't understand why this under this category, and while allowing the warden to consume something making it more powerful sounds interesting, remember, the warden can already 2 shot someone wearing FULL NETHERITE! I feel like buffing it would either be a very small change that shouldn't need to exist, or a complete suicide mission to do without some even more powerful means of protection. Going back to the heart, my only question is why, why the warden, why this particular feature, just what made you come to this conclusion that the warden's heart would be able to store xp?

I don't understand why this under this category, and while allowing the warden to consume something making it more powerful sounds interesting, remember, the warden can already 2 shot someone wearing FULL NETHERITE! I feel like buffing it would either be a very small change that shouldn't need to exist, or a complete suicide mission to do without some even more powerful means of protection. Going back to the heart, my only question is why, why the warden, why this particular feature, just what made you come to this conclusion that the warden's heart would be able to store xp?
This is AWESOME! I hope they add this cuz this is the coolest feature I've seen all day

@Dragolantis So the thought process behind this idea that i came up with is that i persoanlly think the wardens chest already looks like it kind of has xp orbs in it..? The other part is, i think it would be really useful for players to have some sort of way of storing xp. Maybe you craft like “an xp lock box” kind of thing when u surround the warden heart with obsidian, max capacity is 100 levels or so..?

I like the use for the heart, but the methods of obtaining it don't seem to fit the gameplay of the Deep Dark that the devs seem to be going for.
Maybe have the heart as a physical tile entity/block hidden in the Deep Dark that kills the Warden and drops as your reward upon it's destruction, incentivizing players to sneak around the Warden rather than face it head on as the devs intend.
I think we should add both as both are endangered.

Yes!! this is a great idea! Minecraft did this for bees and axolots, why not rhinos? there are only 5,000 rhinos left in the wild!! Please add these, they are my favorite animal! Besides the platypus, maybe you could add those too? Just a thought, :D.
I think this is a great idea because 1 rhinos would be an awesome animal to see. 2 it would raise awareness for sure. And 3 if Minecraft can do it for bees, axolots, and polar bears why not a rhino
They should the white rhino as well since both rhinos are endangered and their could be both kinds
Why? It’s a video game. Raising awareness is best done by a commercial

I am all for this idea but the only thing I think you should consider is what purpose would this animal bring to the game beside raising awareness to its species like what would it drop and things like that

I like this idea, Minecraft tends to choose more unexpected choices so a rhino that's black would fit in nicely- yes I know that black rhinos aren't actually black, but I Minecraft would make them black as it would confuse most players if the "black rhino" was grey. And it would help players remember this particular type of rhino, which is the goal. Also its cooler.

An important thing to remember is that Mojang doesn't add mobs willy nilly. Each mob is well thought through so that when it is added it integrates into the world nicely. At least that's how things are done now.

Every mob needs some sort of purpose, for clearness we will confine ourselves to passive real animal mobs. Armadillos were not just added because they're fun, they brought wolf armor. Axolotls give admittedly no reward that's important, but they seem too me like a reward in and of themselves because they are a rare find, and than there's the whole blue axolotl chance with is fun.

The rhino needs to give a reward, but we don't want to encourage players to kill these mobs, as that defeats the purpose. One option would be to have it dig up something using its horn (touting a little known rhino feature, and teaching people that rhinos horse aren't simply for fights).

However a rhino can't simply be hostile in Minecraft. All Minecraft hostile mobs must be fantasy. This is a rule that mojang has set and after thinking about it a lot I really like this rule and respect it greatly.
I need more information before I can make a judgement
sounds great I think they should add it but it sounds a little OP
I think it's a amazing idea and I actually wanted a new mob in the end and I would love for it to happen someday.
I does sound a bit wild, and I think that making all endermen agro onto you simultaneously would be Fundy level difficult, but otherwise is a cool idea!

Splendid idea my dear friend. It is actually surprising that we still don't have any mobs using shields.

Agreed! One of the main reasons I voted for Mob D was to get a land dwelling mob that couldn't be solved by just shooting arrows.

I REALLY want a tank hostile mob that actually uses shields. This makes certain weapons such as piercing crossbows, axes, and splash potions very useful. Even flint and steel becomes a useful weapon! It's a lot better than just spamming your sword and bow everywhere, which gets boring.

This is a very creative idea!  I could totally see this in game!

Please note that personal information, (usernames, real names, last names, stuff that isn't names, etc.) is NOT to be shared on the Minecraft Feedback site.

Also, this idea sounds very interesting, but could you please add some more information? That would be helpful. For instance, what would the divebomber look like? How big would it be? And any other information that would make this mob unique. Thank you!

Wow! This sounds like one awesome horror/sci-fi movie! Great idea. Only, as I keep saying to others, it seems too advanced for Minecraft, too modern. This one actually seems like it came from the future! but I think that the atmosphere of Minecraft would be severely tainted by adding anything TOO advanced, after all, we don't even have cannons yet, (in Minecraft) let alone genetic engineering technology.

It's still a super cool idea, but I'm not sure it really fits into Minecraft.

(You should write a book about this though!!!)
can you explain to me

The author is saying that a spider should be able to crawl across the bottom of a block- that is to say, they should be able to crawl across the bottom of a block that is above them.

Personally, I agree.
Yes, Yes, and Yes! Why should skeletons get all the fun?
ساعدوني في التصويت
That's ridiculous.

i do feel like the game need one more boss, but you can't just make it an extension of an already existing mob. to make a successful mob, it needs to

A. balance out the game. you can't just put another ender dragon into the game and have it drop nothing. you need an original idea, or a majority of the fandom agree on your idea, then make sure it doesn't destroy the ecosystem.

B. have some real world basis. mobs like the creeper or phantom are fantastical, made-up creatures. and while it may feel cool to do something like that, it is better to start off with something simple. that doesn't mean it cant be a made-up creature, but it needs to have some real world thing or animal as a base. 

and

C. have purpose. a mob can't just exist just because it feels like it has to. it needs to do something, like add a new potion effect, or a new weapon, or something under those lines. 

if you want an example, i made a mob following these guidelines on my post-New 1.21 Hopefully Mob! 

hope this helped!

(P.S. if i offended you i am sorry)
so it wants to be killed?

Deers would be pretty cool, but with the zombie riding a wolf. I think they need too add zombie variants to mobs that babies ride on for example. Zombie riding a wolf? Zombie wolf. Zombie riding a chicken? Zombie Chicken.
i think we should add these, but you need to give more presentation to get a point across (not to nit-pick but you misspelled deer).
